intro: Tephrosia pungens, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, butterfly-like flowers. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It has a taproot system and can grow up to several meters in height, making it a notable species in its native habitats. Tephrosia pungens is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
